definition: of high birth or exalted rank : aristocratic
examples: … my sire is of a noble line …

definition: possessing very high or excellent qualities or properties

examples: See that there be a noble supper provided …

definition: grand or impressive especially in appearance
possessing, characterized by, or arising from superiority of mind or character or of ideals or morals : lofty
chemically inert or inactive especially toward oxygen, — compare base entry 3 sense 2a
examples: a noble metal such as platinum

definition: a person of noble rank or birth
an old English gold coin equivalent to 6 shillings and 8 pence
